topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1 and 1.1.1: Locating IP Address

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1: Locating IP Addresses

p.b: This document describes the installation process for HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1 and HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1.1.

body.p: (If you already have 1.1 installed, you can update Helion OpenStack(R) from 1.1 to 1.1.1 by following the update procedures described in HP Helion OpenStack(R) 1.1.1 Update Guide.)
If you need to locate IP addresses of the seed VM, the undercloud node or the overcloud controller, see the following sections.

li.xref: Locate the Seed VM IP Address

section.title: Locate the Seed VM IP Address
section.p: To locate the seed VM IP address, from the seed cloud host, using either of the following methods, based on preference.

section.title: Using virsh and ARP commands
section.p: You can locate the seed VM MAC address in the virsh configuration file and use ARP to locate the IP address of that MAC address.

li.p: Use the virsh CLI to display information on the seed VM.

Use the arp command to locate the IP address using the MAC address.

section.p: The seed VM IP address for this cloud is 10.23.70.10.

section.title: Using the ARP cache
section.p: You can use ARP commands to locate the IP address of the seed VM interface, virbr

li.p: Use ARP commands to print the seed VM IP to the screen:

codeblock.codeph:
sudo ping -c 1 10.22.157.30
PING 10.22.157.30 (10.22.157.30) 56(84) bytes of data. 64 bytes from 10.22.157.30: icmp_seq=1 ttl=64 time=0.046 ms --- 10.22.157.30 ping statistics --- 1 packets transmitted, 1 received, 0% packet loss, time 0ms rtt min/avg/max/mdev = 0.046/0.046/0.046/0.000 ms
arp -n | grep virbr | grep -v incomplete | awk '{print$1}') 10.23.70.10

section.p: The seed VM IP address for this cloud is 10.23.70.10.

section.title: Locate the Undercloud IP Address
section.p: To locate the IP address needed to log into the undercloud node:

codeblock.codeph: . /root/stackrc UNDERCLOUD_IP=$(nova list | cut -d '|' -f 7 | grep ctlplane | awk -F = '{print $2}') echo $UNDERCLOUD_IP

section.title: Locate the Overcloud IP Address
section.p: To locate the IP address to log into the overcloud controller:

codeblock.codeph: . /root/tripleo/tripleo-undercloud-passwords TE_DATAFILE=/root/tripleo/ce_env.json . /root/tripleo/tripleo-incubator/undercloudrc OVERCLOUD_IP=$(heat output-show overcloud-ce-controller KeystoneURL | cut -d: -f2 | sed s,/,,g ) echo $OVERCLOUD_IP
